<script>
if (window.location.pathname === '/') {
  if (localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "online-banking" || localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "personal-online_banking_per") {
    window.location.href = "/online-banking";
  } else if (localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "healthcare" || localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "personal-hs_per" || localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "business-hs_bus") {
    window.location.href = "/hsa-online-access";
  } else if (localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "umb-direct" || localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "business-umb_direct_bus") {
    window.location.href = "/umb-direct";
  } else if (localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "business-online-banking" || localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "business-online_banking_bus") {
    window.location.href = "/business-online-banking";
  } else if (localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "web-exchange" || localStorage.getItem('umbpreviousLogin') === "business-web_exchange") {
    window.location.href = "/web-exchange";
  }
}
</script>

               <div class="coh-container ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-496b5f29-8ce5-436a-9edd-6466b83bcda0 coh-component-instance-496b5f29-8ce5-436a-9edd-6466b83bcda0 none col-style-full-width coh-style-padding-top-bottom-small coh-ce-cpt_1_column_layout-c6971476" >  <div class="coh-container col-style-full-width coh-ce-cpt_1_column_layout-5fc9960c coh-container-boxed" > <div class="coh-row coh-row-xl coh-row-visible-xl" data-coh-row-match-heights="[]"> <div class="coh-row-inner "> <div class="coh-column coh-col-xl coh-col-xl-push-0 coh-col-xl-pull-0 coh-col-xl-offset-0" >                  <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-239d102c-b331-4573-bb55-38d16fe6a7b0 coh-component-instance-239d102c-b331-4573-bb55-38d16fe6a7b0  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-639a4243ee4e441f077fbbf92bc0f1df coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p> </p>
<p> </p>
<figure class="coh-style-responsive-table"><table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th><strong>BENEFITS</strong></th>
<th><strong>UMB SIMPLY REWARDS</strong></th>
<th><strong>UMB TRAVEL SELECT</strong></th>
<th><strong>UMB DIRECT CASH</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th><strong>Valuable Earnings</strong></th>
<td>Earn three points per dollar spent at gas stations, grocery stores, discount stores, restaurants and fast food locations. Earn one point per dollar spent on all other purchases.<sup>1</sup></td>
<td>Earn three points per dollar spent on airfare, hotels, resorts, cruise ships, car rentals and tour buses. Earn one point per dollar spent on all other purchases.<sup>3</sup></td>
<td>Earn 1.5 points per dollar spent on all net purchases. Deposit your cash back into a UMB Checking or Savings account and use 10% fewer points when compared to redeeming for a statement credit.<sup>2</sup></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th><strong>Easy to Understand</strong></th>
<td>No promotions to activate. No cap on the amount of points you can earn.</td>
<td>No promotions to activate. No cap on the amount of points you can earn.</td>
<td>No promotions to activate. No cap on the amount of points you can earn.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th><strong>Introductory Offers</strong></th>
<td>
<ul>
<li>15,000 Bonus Points when you spend $1,500 in the first 90 days of account opening.<sup>4</sup></li>
<li>0% Introductory Purchase APR for 12 months, then a variable APR of 16.24% to 24.24% based on your creditworthiness.<sup>5</sup></li>

Secured by a deposit equal to the amount of your line of credit, you can use this card for everyday items or unexpected expenses. And by making responsible monthly payments, you’ll be on the right track towards establishing or improving your credit history.<sup>6</sup> Visit a UMB branch to apply or learn more.</p>

 </div> </div> </div> <div class="coh-column text_and_image coh-ce-cpt_text_and_image-b98dcb10 coh-visible-sm coh-col-sm-12 coh-visible-xl coh-col-xl-5 coh-col-xl-push-0 coh-col-xl-pull-0 coh-col-xl-offset-0" >  <div class="coh-inline-element fade-in-down parallax-div dx8-parallax coh-ce-cpt_text_and_image-bef031cf" data-coh-paroller="{"xl":{"factor":"","type":"background","direction":"vertical","bgstart":"","enabled":false}}"> <div class="coh-inline-element text_and_image coh-ce-cpt_text_and_image-558758e2">  <h2 class="coh-heading coh-style-heading-1-size coh-ce-cpt_text_and_image-6db54b51"  > Are you a UMB Private Banking client? </h2>  </div>  <div class="coh-inline-element text_and_image description coh-ce-cpt_text_and_image-d600e410">   <div class="coh-wysiwyg"  >    <p>Our Private Banking clients are eligible to apply for the UMB Visa® Signature Preferred Rewards Credit Card. With premium benefits that emphasize simplicity, security and service, this card allows you to earn up to 2% cash back<sup>7</sup> on your net purchases. Cash back is automatically redeemed as an account credit each quarter with a minimum redemption amount of $50.</p>
 </div>     <a href="/personal-banking/private-banking/private-bank-visa" class="coh-link button-with-coh-style-heading-1-size coh-style-link-button-primary-dark-small coh-ce-cpt_text_and_image-334d0563" target="_self" > Learn more    </a>  </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>   </div> 
 
                 <div class="coh-container ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-a19f468e-d3ef-4112-8160-7d0a04f9dba5 coh-component-instance-a19f468e-d3ef-4112-8160-7d0a04f9dba5 coh-style-padding-top-bottom-small align-text-center coh-ce-cpt_heading-63ac6184" >  <div class="coh-container coh-container-boxed" > <h2 class="coh-heading visually-hidden js-section-heading coh-style-heading-2-size coh-style-umb-gradient align-text-center  ssa-instance-fb71ea6922a04db6f0487da9442f1568 coh-ce-cpt_heading-7786292b" id="faq"  > FAQs </h2> </div> </div> 
                 <div class="coh-container ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-4f341a4e-cf3f-4c9d-befe-e7ced32084cc coh-component-instance-4f341a4e-cf3f-4c9d-befe-e7ced32084cc coh-style-text-color-dark-background no-padding coh-ce-cpt_accordion_container-dd8e603b" >  <div class="coh-container coh-container-boxed" > <div class="coh-row coh-row-xl coh-row-visible-xl" data-coh-row-match-heights="{"xl":{"target":"none"}}"> <div class="coh-row-inner"> <div class="coh-column coh-visible-sm coh-col-sm-12 coh-col-sm-offset-0 coh-visible-xl coh-col-xl-8 coh-col-xl-push-0 coh-col-xl-pull-0 coh-col-xl-offset-2" >   <h2 class="coh-heading acc-heading coh-ce-cpt_accordion_container-fca8d376"  > Questions about Credit Cards? UMB has answers. </h2>     <div class="coh-accordion-tabs"> <div class="coh-accordion-tabs-inner coh-accordion-tabs-horizontal-center coh-accordion-tabs-display-accordion-xl  coh-ce-cpt_accordion_container-f7edb4e1" data-coh-accordion="{"title":"Accordion container","styles":{"xl":{"accordionOrTab":"accordion","collapsible":true,"startCollapsed":"false","offsetPositionAgainst":"px","scrollToAccordionOffset":100,"accordionTabWidth":-2,"accordionTabBleed":"retain_gutters","animation":"slide","duration":400},"sm":[]},"scrollToAccordion":false,"setHash":true,"horizontalVertical":"horizontal_top","HorizontalPosition":"center_aligned","VerticalPosition":"left","customStyle":null}"> <ul class="coh-accordion-tabs-nav"></ul> <div class="coh-accordion-tabs-content-wrapper">             <div class="coh-accordion-title" data-coh-tab-settings='[]'><a href="#230548828-776826581" >How many credit cards should I have?</a></div> <div id="230548828-776826581" class="coh-accordion-tabs-content ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-6359f07f-77c0-4599-8dc3-9d8d3d37daf4 coh-component-instance-6359f07f-77c0-4599-8dc3-9d8d3d37daf4 coh-ce-cpt_accordion_item-4f4205ef"  >  <div class="coh-container " >              <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-ef9d8b16-659a-4d3b-b2bf-c42aa92a0a09 coh-component-instance-ef9d8b16-659a-4d3b-b2bf-c42aa92a0a09  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-8feaa3c4cce16c975bc7fca2ec2954b7 coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">A credit card can be a helpful tool in your personal financial toolkit. Opening at least one card and paying it on time helps build your credit history and boost your credit score.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">But how many credit cards should you have? There’s not one right answer for everyone. It depends on a few things, including your financial situation, financial goals and spending habits.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Know your spending habits</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">If you have stable income and can easily pay a monthly card balance, having a few credit cards may be smart. You could use certain cards for daily purchases, like gas or groceries, to help you budget and potentially save money.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Many credit cards offer incentives for rewards, travel or cash back. Loyalty-program credit cards from retail stores often offer points toward purchases or extra discounts.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">If you’re starting out in college or career, opening just one credit card might be a good option. You can use it to pay bills from a single source, making it easier to track payments. In the meantime, you’d accumulate a solid credit history by paying the card on time and keeping it open.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Either way, know your financial situation and do your research to find your best credit card options. <a style="background-color:transparent;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(0, 114, 173);list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;" href="#compare"><u>UMB offers a few credit cards to fit your lifestyle</u></a>.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Make your credit card work for you</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">A credit card can help build credit history, boost credit score and offer some perks when used responsibly. UMB encourages our customers to make informed financial decisions. Check out this article for more <a style="background-color:transparent;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(0, 114, 173);list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;" href="https://blog.umb.com/umb-bank-guide-understand-your-credit-cards-budget/"><u>tips on using your credit cards</u></a>.</p>
 </div> 
   </div> </div> 
           <div class="coh-accordion-title" data-coh-tab-settings='[]'><a href="#230548828-2167633061" >How do credit cards work</a></div> <div id="230548828-2167633061" class="coh-accordion-tabs-content ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-c64c6468-4623-46bc-9fd0-bfc286f1e731 coh-component-instance-c64c6468-4623-46bc-9fd0-bfc286f1e731 coh-ce-cpt_accordion_item-4f4205ef"  >  <div class="coh-container " >              <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-05f08cc7-f03c-4ceb-b3fa-5b435d59deb5 coh-component-instance-05f08cc7-f03c-4ceb-b3fa-5b435d59deb5  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-a43682a261a173f834b80ce7ccd24c69 coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Knowing how your credit card works can help you get the most benefits from using a credit card. Here’s a quick look at how credit cards work:</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">A credit card isn’t a debit card</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">A debit card is connected to your personal checking account. Each time you use a debit card to make a purchase or pay a bill, there’s a simultaneous electronic withdrawal from your checking account.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Using a credit card is like taking out a short-term loan. A credit card company approves you to borrow a certain amount of money, and you’ll have to pay it back.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Know your credit limit</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">A credit limit is the total amount of money you can borrow on your credit card. Your available credit is reduced every time you make a charge. If your credit limit is $1,000 and you make a purchase for $200, your remaining available credit is $800.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Grace periods and interest fees</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">The credit card grace period is the time between when you make a charge and when the bill is due. Pay your credit card in full by the due date each statement period, and your account won’t accrue interest.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">If you pay anything less than the full monthly balance, your account is charged interest. Interest is based on your credit card’s APR, or annual percentage rate.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Understand your credit card bill</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Your monthly credit card bill shows the New Balance and the Minimum Payment Due. The Minimum Payment Due is the least amount you can pay by the due date to avoid a late fee. But if you only pay the minimum, your account will accrue interest because you’re paying less than the full amount you owe.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Maintain healthy credit</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Credit cards can help you build a strong credit history. But carrying too much debt, making late payments or missing payments can severely hurt your credit. </p>
 </div> 
   </div> </div> 
           <div class="coh-accordion-title" data-coh-tab-settings='[]'><a href="#230548828-4280690833" >What is an APR on a credit card?</a></div> <div id="230548828-4280690833" class="coh-accordion-tabs-content ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-f32947c4-319c-41fd-b3e3-700fefd5f167 coh-component-instance-f32947c4-319c-41fd-b3e3-700fefd5f167 coh-ce-cpt_accordion_item-4f4205ef"  >  <div class="coh-container " >              <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-80d99712-f651-4fe4-9aa8-72373d80f5fe coh-component-instance-80d99712-f651-4fe4-9aa8-72373d80f5fe  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-bec528223d85c48b64984f16c66409d8 coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p><span style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255);color:rgb(75, 75, 75);display:inline !important;float:none;font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;orphans:2;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">An APR on a credit card stands for “annual percentage rate.” In simplest terms, an APR is used to calculate the interest you’re charged when you carry a balance on a credit card.</span></p>
<p><span style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255);color:rgb(75, 75, 75);display:inline !important;float:none;font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;orphans:2;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">If you pay less than the total monthly balance, a credit card company will charge you interest on your revolving balance and on future advances until the balance is paid in full. If you always pay your total monthly balance, you’re not charged interest.</span></p>
<p><span style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255);color:rgb(75, 75, 75);display:inline !important;float:none;font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;orphans:2;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Credit cards come with varying APRs. Your credit history and perceived credit risk can affect the APR on your credit card. Typically, the higher (or better) your credit score, the lower your APR.</span></p>
<p><span style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255);color:rgb(75, 75, 75);display:inline !important;float:none;font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;orphans:2;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">For an in-depth look at credit cards and more, check out </span><a style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;background-color:transparent;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(0, 114, 173);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;list-style:none;margin:0px;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;" href="https://umb-bank.everfi-next.net/student/dashboard/financial-education/umb-bank-family-finances?locale=en"><u>UMB’s free online personal finance courses</u></a><span style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255);color:rgb(75, 75, 75);display:inline !important;float:none;font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;orphans:2;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">.</span></p>
 </div> 
   </div> </div> 
           <div class="coh-accordion-title" data-coh-tab-settings='[]'><a href="#230548828-561934108" >How do I apply for a credit card?</a></div> <div id="230548828-561934108" class="coh-accordion-tabs-content ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-9d449eec-f185-47ad-97af-8dd4a122d07a coh-component-instance-9d449eec-f185-47ad-97af-8dd4a122d07a coh-ce-cpt_accordion_item-4f4205ef"  >  <div class="coh-container " >              <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-144f72ef-b1f0-4bdd-861d-9d231ef0cf70 coh-component-instance-144f72ef-b1f0-4bdd-861d-9d231ef0cf70  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-05aa35b512b61b076f4b73ed94be22f9 coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">You can apply for a credit card a few ways: a direct-mail application, online at credit card company website or at a bank branch. Retail stores often allow you to apply for a credit card in-store with customer service.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">UMB offers several options to help you find the right credit card for you. You can apply for a credit card online today.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">What you need for a credit card application</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">All credit card applications require personal information, like your name, address, Social Security number, income and monthly housing payment. A credit card company uses this to research your credit history to determine eligibility and if you’re approved, to determine your credit limit.<br> </p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Credit history and several other factors are considered before your application is approved. Before you even apply, consider these questions first:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">How do credit cards work? </p>
</li>
<li>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">What is the best credit card for me?</p>
</li>
<li>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">How many credit cards should I have? </p>
</li>
</ul>
 </div> 
   </div> </div> 
           <div class="coh-accordion-title" data-coh-tab-settings='[]'><a href="#230548828-3787880151" >How can I get a credit card with no credit?</a></div> <div id="230548828-3787880151" class="coh-accordion-tabs-content ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-597d5fba-e058-4449-9362-11e743440b98 coh-component-instance-597d5fba-e058-4449-9362-11e743440b98 coh-ce-cpt_accordion_item-4f4205ef"  >  <div class="coh-container " >              <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-26d12b3b-3b27-429e-8ef2-ca81a7482f4e coh-component-instance-26d12b3b-3b27-429e-8ef2-ca81a7482f4e  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-83acf3ce584c0e195686dbd171679785 coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">It might seem frustrating: To get a credit card, you often need to have credit history. But you can’t build credit history if you’ve never had credit (like a credit card or loan).</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">In this case, a secured credit card may be a good option to help you begin to build or restore your credit score. A secured credit card is “secured” by a cash deposit. Your line of credit, or credit limit, is equal to the amount of that deposit.</p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Apply for a UMB secured credit card</strong></p>
<p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">You can use a secured credit card for everyday items or unexpected expenses. And by making responsible monthly payments, you’ll be on track towards building your credit history. To apply or learn more about UMB’s secured credit card option, schedule an appointment with a personal banker at a <a style="background-color:transparent;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(0, 114, 173);list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;" href="https://locations.umb.com/"><u>UMB branch</u></a>.</p>
 </div> 
   </div> </div> 
           <div class="coh-accordion-title" data-coh-tab-settings='[]'><a href="#230548828-2365500169" >What is the best credit card for me?</a></div> <div id="230548828-2365500169" class="coh-accordion-tabs-content ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-800e7595-d3c1-4d5b-95a3-06feb462c070 coh-component-instance-800e7595-d3c1-4d5b-95a3-06feb462c070 coh-ce-cpt_accordion_item-4f4205ef"  >  <div class="coh-container " >              <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-1e8cd55e-1abb-4970-9e61-9d317fc70c60 coh-component-instance-1e8cd55e-1abb-4970-9e61-9d317fc70c60  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-45a0a4c4541072a9863b5ef665ea9289 coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:1.5 !important;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding:0px;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;">Credit card companies offer a wide range of options, interest rates and rewards. Focus your search for the best credit card for you with these questions:</p>
<ol class="pt-0 pl-4" style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding-bottom:0px;padding-left:1.5rem !important;padding-right:0px;padding-top:0px !important;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;" dir="ltr">
<li style="border-bottom:0px;border-image:initial;border-left:0px;border-right:0px;border-top:none;box-sizing:border-box;font-size:1rem;list-style:decimal;margin-bottom:0px !important;margin-left:0px;margin-right:0px;margin-top:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">What’s my credit history and credit score?</strong></li>
</ol>
<p>It's important to check your credit history and credit score on a regular basis. Lenders use this score to evaluate your creditworthiness. Each of the nationwide credit bureaus offer free access to your credit report at <a style="background-color:transparent;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(0, 114, 173);list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;" href="https://www.annualcreditreport.com/index.action"><u>annualcreditreport.com</u></a><img style="background:#fff;display:inline-block;padding:2px;width:15px;" src="/sites/default/files/2023-08/Leave.svg" alt="leaving website icon">.  <br>Credit card companies offer a credit limit and annual percentage rate (APR) based on your previous credit usage and their assessment of your ability to repay the debt you might incur on that credit limit.  <br><br>To get an idea of what limit and rates to expect before you apply for a credit card, know your credit score.</p>
<ol class="pt-0 pl-4" style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding-bottom:0px;padding-left:1.5rem !important;padding-right:0px;padding-top:0px !important;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;" dir="ltr" start="2">
<li style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-size:1rem;list-style:decimal;margin-bottom:0px !important;margin-left:0px;margin-right:0px;margin-top:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">How will I use a credit card?</strong></li>
</ol>
<p>Do you want to build or repair your credit? Earn cash back or points for redemption options? Knowing how you want to use your credit card will help make finding the right one easier.</p>
<ol class="pt-0 pl-4" style="-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(75, 75, 75);font-family:Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-style:normal;font-variant-caps:normal;font-variant-ligatures:normal;font-weight:400;letter-spacing:normal;list-style:none;margin:0px 0px 1rem;orphans:2;outline:none;padding-bottom:0px;padding-left:1.5rem !important;padding-right:0px;padding-top:0px !important;text-align:left;text-decoration-color:initial;text-decoration-style:initial;text-decoration-thickness:initial;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;widows:2;word-spacing:0px;" dir="ltr" start="3">
<li style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-size:1rem;list-style:decimal;margin-bottom:0px !important;margin-left:0px;margin-right:0px;margin-top:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;"><strong style="border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;font-weight:bolder;list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;">Am I willing to pay an annual fee?</strong></li>
</ol>
<p>Usually, credit cards that offer the highest perks also charge an annual fee. If you think the fee is worth it because the card matches your financial goals, then it might be a good idea. There are also many credit cards with little or no annual fees. UMB offers a few different <a style="background-color:transparent;border:0px;box-sizing:border-box;color:rgb(0, 114, 173);list-style:none;margin:0px;outline:none;padding:0px;" href="#compare"><u>Visa credit cards to fit your lifestyle</u></a>.</p>
 </div> 
   </div> </div> 
           <div class="coh-accordion-title" data-coh-tab-settings='[]'><a href="#230548828-1587502347" >How do I redeem my UMB credit card rewards?</a></div> <div id="230548828-1587502347" class="coh-accordion-tabs-content ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-a8729dce-3720-44a1-9326-dceef990e8d7 coh-component-instance-a8729dce-3720-44a1-9326-dceef990e8d7 coh-ce-cpt_accordion_item-4f4205ef"  >  <div class="coh-container " >              <div class="coh-wysiwyg ssa-component coh-component ssa-component-instance-dff7657c-0584-4926-b9ee-0b75357b9c9b coh-component-instance-dff7657c-0584-4926-b9ee-0b75357b9c9b  coh-style-text-color-light-background        ssa-instance-8ba48e2156159bad321f6a5e1864907a coh-ce-cpt_text-fa10298a"  >    <p>Browse your UMB rewards, check your point balance and more with the reward center. Log in to online banking (first-time users will need to create a user ID and password). Once you log in to your UMB online banking dashboard, you can access your credit card rewards with the below steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>Click your credit card account tile</li>
<li>Near the top of the credit card account page, you’ll see two tabs. Select the Details tab.</li>
<li>Scroll down to find your rewards point total. Scroll further to find a link to access/redeem your credit card rewards</li>
<li>Click the link under the Access/Redeem Rewards header</li>
</ol>

<li>UMB Simply Rewards® Visa® Credit Card. Merchant Category Codes (MCCs) eligible for 3 points per dollar spent are the following: 5411 (Grocery Stores), 5541 and 5542 (Gas), 5310 (Discount Stores), 5812 (Restaurants) and 5814 (Fast Food). Cardholders earn 1 point per dollar on all other Net Purchases. See the <a href="https://assets.umb.com/cc-dao/rewards_program_rules/bg03003-umb_simply_rewards_program_rules.pdf">UMB Simply Rewards Program Rules</a> for complete details about this rewards program.</li>
<li>UMB Direct Cash® Visa® Credit Card. Cardholders earn 1.5 points per dollar spent on all Net Purchases. See the <a href="https://assets.umb.com/cc-dao/rewards_program_rules/bg03001-umb_direct_cash_rewards_program_rules.pdf">UMB Direct Cash Program Rules</a> for complete details</li>
<li>UMB Travel Select® Visa® Credit Card. Merchant Category Codes (MCCs) eligible for 3 points per dollar are the following: 3000-3756 (airlines, hotels and resorts), 3780 (resorts), 4131 (tour buses), 4411 (cruise ships), 4511 (other airlines), 7011 (lodging) and 7512 (car rentals). Cardholders earn 1 point per dollar on all other Net Purchases. See the <a href="https://assets.umb.com/cc-dao/rewards_program_rules/bg03005-umb_travel_select_rewards_program_rules.pdf">UMB Travel Select Program Rules</a> for complete details.</li>
<li>Use your new Simply Rewards, Travel Select or Direct Cash credit card to make $1,500 in net purchases within 90 days of account opening and receive 15,000 bonus points. Balance transfers or cash advances are not eligible as part of the $1,500. Bonus Points will be applied to your account within 45 days of meeting the spend requirement. The following transactions are excluded from "purchases" and do not earn rewards points: convenience checks, balance transfers (unless our balance transfer offer specifically says otherwise), cash advances, returns, finance charges and credit card interest or fees.</li>
<li><strong>APRs: APR for Purchases:</strong> 0.00% introductory APR for 12 months. After the first 12 months, 16.24% to 24.24% based on your creditworthiness. This APR will vary with the market based on the prime rate. <strong>APR for Balance Transfers:</strong> 0.00% introductory APR for the first 12 billing cycles for balances transferred within 60 days from account opening. After the first 12 billing cycles, and for balance transfers made more than 60 days from account opening, 16.24% to 24.24% (based on your credit worthiness) if your balance transfer is treated as a purchase, or 29.24% if your balance transfer is treated as a cash advance. Those APRs will vary based on the prime rate. <strong>APR for Cash Advances:</strong> 29.24%. This APR will vary with the market based on the prime rate.<br><strong>Fees: Minimum Interest Charge:</strong> If you are charged interest, the charge will be no less than $0.50. <strong>Annual Fee:</strong> None. <strong>Balance Transfers:</strong> 3% of the amount of the balance transfer, with a $15 minimum and no maximum. <strong>Cash Advances:</strong> 3% of the amount of the cash advance, with a $15 minimum and a $50 maximum. <strong>Foreign Transactions:</strong> 2% of the U. S. dollar amount of each Cash Advance or Purchase (Foreign Transaction Fees are waived for UMB Travel Select cardholders). <strong>Overdraft Protection:</strong> 3% of the amount of the Overdraft Advance, with a $10 minimum and a $25 maximum.<br>We retain the right to change the rates and fees that apply to your account as permitted by applicable law. For more information, <em>see our Important Cost Information about our Credit Card</em> disclosure, which is provided with our credit card application.<br>Information about the costs of credit cards is accurate as of February 1, 2025. This information may have changed after that date. To find out what may have changed, call us at 855.368.0410 or write to us at UMB Bank, n.a., P.O. Box 419734, Kansas City, Missouri 64141-6734.</li>
<li>See the UMB Individual Secured Visa® Credit Card Application for details.</li>
<li>UMB Private Bank Visa® Signature Preferred Credit Card earns 1.35% cash back rewards when you spend up to $4,999.99 in net purchases in any statement cycle. But if your monthly net purchases with the card are between $5,000 and $9,999.99, you will earn 1.50% cash back rewards on all net purchases during that monthly cycle. And if your net purchases are $10,000 or more in a statement cycle, you will earn 2.00% cash back rewards for all net purchases with the card that month. Cash back is awarded as a statement credit.</li>
<li>Visa's Zero Liability Protection covers U.S.-issued cards only and does not apply to certain commercial card transactions. You must notify your financial institution immediately of any unauthorized use. For specific restrictions, limitations and other details, please consult your Issuer.</li>
<li>Auto rental insurance provided at no additional cost. Certain exclusions and conditions apply. See the Visa Guide to Benefits for details. We will send you the Guide to Benefits with your card.</li>

</ol>

Learn more 
FAQs 
Questions about Credit Cards? UMB has
answers. 
How many credit cards should I have?
A credit card can be a helpful tool in your personal financial toolkit. Opening at least one
card and paying it on time helps build your credit history and boost your credit score.
But how many credit cards should you have? There’s not one right answer for everyone.
It depends on a few things, including your financial situation, financial goals and
spending habits.
Know your spending habits
If you have stable income and can easily pay a monthly card balance, having a few
credit cards may be smart. You could use certain cards for daily purchases, like gas or
groceries, to help you budget and potentially save money.
Many credit cards offer incentives for rewards, travel or cash back. Loyalty-program
credit cards from retail stores often offer points toward purchases or extra discounts.
If you’re starting out in college or career, opening just one credit card might be a good
option. You can use it to pay bills from a single source, making it easier to track
payments. In the meantime, you’d accumulate a solid credit history by paying the card
on time and keeping it open.
Either way, know your financial situation and do your research to find your best credit
card options. UMB offers a few credit cards to fit your lifestyle.
Make your credit card work for you
body_pages.12:
A credit card can help build credit history, boost credit score and offer some perks when
used responsibly. UMB encourages our customers to make informed financial
decisions. Check out this article for more tips on using your credit cards.
How do credit cards work
Knowing how your credit card works can help you get the most benefits from using a
credit card. Here’s a quick look at how credit cards work:
A credit card isn’t a debit card
A debit card is connected to your personal checking account. Each time you use a debit
card to make a purchase or pay a bill, there’s a simultaneous electronic withdrawal from
your checking account.
Using a credit card is like taking out a short-term loan. A credit card company approves
you to borrow a certain amount of money, and you’ll have to pay it back.
Know your credit limit
A credit limit is the total amount of money you can borrow on your credit card. Your
available credit is reduced every time you make a charge. If your credit limit is $1,000
and you make a purchase for $200, your remaining available credit is $800.
Grace periods and interest fees
The credit card grace period is the time between when you make a charge and when the
bill is due. Pay your credit card in full by the due date each statement period, and your
account won’t accrue interest.
If you pay anything less than the full monthly balance, your account is charged interest.
Interest is based on your credit card’s APR, or annual percentage rate.
Understand your credit card bill
Your monthly credit card bill shows the New Balance and the Minimum Payment Due.
The Minimum Payment Due is the least amount you can pay by the due date to avoid a
late fee. But if you only pay the minimum, your account will accrue interest because
you’re paying less than the full amount you owe.
Maintain healthy credit
Credit cards can help you build a strong credit history. But carrying too much debt,
making late payments or missing payments can severely hurt your credit. 
What is an APR on a credit card?
body_pages.13:
An APR on a credit card stands for “annual percentage rate.” In simplest terms, an APR
is used to calculate the interest you’re charged when you carry a balance on a credit
card.
If you pay less than the total monthly balance, a credit card company will charge you
interest on your revolving balance and on future advances until the balance is paid in
full. If you always pay your total monthly balance, you’re not charged interest.
Credit cards come with varying APRs. Your credit history and perceived credit risk can
affect the APR on your credit card. Typically, the higher (or better) your credit score, the
lower your APR.
For an in-depth look at credit cards and more, check out UMB’s free online personal
finance courses.
How do I apply for a credit card?
You can apply for a credit card a few ways: a direct-mail application, online at credit
card company website or at a bank branch. Retail stores often allow you to apply for a
credit card in-store with customer service.
UMB offers several options to help you find the right credit card for you. You can apply
for a credit card online today.
What you need for a credit card application
All credit card applications require personal information, like your name, address, Social
Security number, income and monthly housing payment. A credit card company uses
this to research your credit history to determine eligibility and if you’re approved, to
determine your credit limit.
Credit history and several other factors are considered before your application is
approved. Before you even apply, consider these questions first:
How do credit cards work? 
What is the best credit card for me?
How many credit cards should I have? 
How can I get a credit card with no credit?
It might seem frustrating: To get a credit card, you often need to have credit history. But
you can’t build credit history if you’ve never had credit (like a credit card or loan).
In this case, a secured credit card may be a good option to help you begin to build or
restore your credit score. A secured credit card is “secured” by a cash deposit. Your line
of credit, or credit limit, is equal to the amount of that deposit.
• 
• 
•
body_pages.14:
Apply for a UMB secured credit card
You can use a secured credit card for everyday items or unexpected expenses. And by
making responsible monthly payments, you’ll be on track towards building your credit
history. To apply or learn more about UMB’s secured credit card option, schedule an
appointment with a personal banker at a UMB branch.
What is the best credit card for me?
Credit card companies offer a wide range of options, interest rates and rewards. Focus
your search for the best credit card for you with these questions:
What’s my credit history and credit score?
It's important to check your credit history and credit score on a regular
basis. Lenders use this score to evaluate your creditworthiness. Each of the
nationwide credit bureaus offer free access to your credit report at 
annualcreditreport.com
.  
Credit card companies offer a credit limit and annual percentage rate (APR)
based on your previous credit usage and their assessment of your ability to
repay the debt you might incur on that credit limit.  
To get an idea of what limit and rates to expect before you apply for a credit
card, know your credit score.
How will I use a credit card?
Do you want to build or repair your credit? Earn cash back or points for
redemption options? Knowing how you want to use your credit card will
help make finding the right one easier.
Am I willing to pay an annual fee?
Usually, credit cards that offer the highest perks also charge an annual fee.
If you think the fee is worth it because the card matches your financial
goals, then it might be a good idea. There are also many credit cards with
little or no annual fees. UMB offers a few different Visa credit cards to fit
your lifestyle.
How do I redeem my UMB credit card rewards?
Browse your UMB rewards, check your point balance and more with the
reward center. Log in to online banking (first-time users will need to create
a user ID and password). Once you log in to your UMB online banking
dashboard, you can access your credit card rewards with the below steps:
Click your credit card account tile
Near the top of the credit card account page, you’ll see two tabs.
Select the Details tab.

FAQs 
Questions about Credit Cards? UMB has
answers. 
How many credit cards should I have?
A credit card can be a helpful tool in your personal financial toolkit. Opening at least one
card and paying it on time helps build your credit history and boost your credit score.
But how many credit cards should you have? There’s not one right answer for everyone.
It depends on a few things, including your financial situation, financial goals and
spending habits.
Know your spending habits
If you have stable income and can easily pay a monthly card balance, having a few
credit cards may be smart. You could use certain cards for daily purchases, like gas or
groceries, to help you budget and potentially save money.
Many credit cards offer incentives for rewards, travel or cash back. Loyalty-program
credit cards from retail stores often offer points toward purchases or extra discounts.
If you’re starting out in college or career, opening just one credit card might be a good
option. You can use it to pay bills from a single source, making it easier to track
payments. In the meantime, you’d accumulate a solid credit history by paying the card
on time and keeping it open.
Either way, know your financial situation and do your research to find your best credit
card options. UMB offers a few credit cards to fit your lifestyle.
Make your credit card work for you
A credit card can help build credit history, boost credit score and offer some perks when
used responsibly. UMB encourages our customers to make informed financial
decisions. Check out this article for more tips on using your credit cards.
How do credit cards work
Knowing how your credit card works can help you get the most benefits from using a
credit card. Here’s a quick look at how credit cards work:
A credit card isn’t a debit card
A debit card is connected to your personal checking account. Each time you use a debit
card to make a purchase or pay a bill, there’s a simultaneous electronic withdrawal from
your checking account.
Using a credit card is like taking out a short-term loan. A credit card company approves
you to borrow a certain amount of money, and you’ll have to pay it back.
Know your credit limit
A credit limit is the total amount of money you can borrow on your credit card. Your
available credit is reduced every time you make a charge. If your credit limit is $1,000
and you make a purchase for $200, your remaining available credit is $800.
Grace periods and interest fees
The credit card grace period is the time between when you make a charge and when the
bill is due. Pay your credit card in full by the due date each statement period, and your
account won’t accrue interest.
If you pay anything less than the full monthly balance, your account is charged interest.
Interest is based on your credit card’s APR, or annual percentage rate.
Understand your credit card bill
Your monthly credit card bill shows the New Balance and the Minimum Payment Due.
The Minimum Payment Due is the least amount you can pay by the due date to avoid a
late fee. But if you only pay the minimum, your account will accrue interest because
you’re paying less than the full amount you owe.
Maintain healthy credit
Credit cards can help you build a strong credit history. But carrying too much debt,
making late payments or missing payments can severely hurt your credit. 
What is an APR on a credit card?
An APR on a credit card stands for “annual percentage rate.” In simplest terms, an APR
is used to calculate the interest you’re charged when you carry a balance on a credit
card.
If you pay less than the total monthly balance, a credit card company will charge you
interest on your revolving balance and on future advances until the balance is paid in
full. If you always pay your total monthly balance, you’re not charged interest.
Credit cards come with varying APRs. Your credit history and perceived credit risk can
affect the APR on your credit card. Typically, the higher (or better) your credit score, the
lower your APR.
For an in-depth look at credit cards and more, check out UMB’s free online personal
finance courses.
How do I apply for a credit card?
You can apply for a credit card a few ways: a direct-mail application, online at credit
card company website or at a bank branch. Retail stores often allow you to apply for a
credit card in-store with customer service.
UMB offers several options to help you find the right credit card for you. You can apply
for a credit card online today.
What you need for a credit card application
All credit card applications require personal information, like your name, address, Social
Security number, income and monthly housing payment. A credit card company uses
this to research your credit history to determine eligibility and if you’re approved, to
determine your credit limit.
Credit history and several other factors are considered before your application is
approved. Before you even apply, consider these questions first:
How do credit cards work? 
What is the best credit card for me?
How many credit cards should I have? 
How can I get a credit card with no credit?
It might seem frustrating: To get a credit card, you often need to have credit history. But
you can’t build credit history if you’ve never had credit (like a credit card or loan).
In this case, a secured credit card may be a good option to help you begin to build or
restore your credit score. A secured credit card is “secured” by a cash deposit. Your line
of credit, or credit limit, is equal to the amount of that deposit.
• 
• 
• 
Apply for a UMB secured credit card
You can use a secured credit card for everyday items or unexpected expenses. And by
making responsible monthly payments, you’ll be on track towards building your credit
history. To apply or learn more about UMB’s secured credit card option, schedule an
appointment with a personal banker at a UMB branch.
What is the best credit card for me?
Credit card companies offer a wide range of options, interest rates and rewards. Focus
your search for the best credit card for you with these questions:
What’s my credit history and credit score?
It's important to check your credit history and credit score on a regular
basis. Lenders use this score to evaluate your creditworthiness. Each of the
nationwide credit bureaus offer free access to your credit report at 
annualcreditreport.com
.  
Credit card companies offer a credit limit and annual percentage rate (APR)
based on your previous credit usage and their assessment of your ability to
repay the debt you might incur on that credit limit.  
To get an idea of what limit and rates to expect before you apply for a credit
card, know your credit score.
How will I use a credit card?
Do you want to build or repair your credit? Earn cash back or points for
redemption options? Knowing how you want to use your credit card will
help make finding the right one easier.
Am I willing to pay an annual fee?
Usually, credit cards that offer the highest perks also charge an annual fee.
If you think the fee is worth it because the card matches your financial
goals, then it might be a good idea. There are also many credit cards with
little or no annual fees. UMB offers a few different Visa credit cards to fit
your lifestyle.
How do I redeem my UMB credit card rewards?
Browse your UMB rewards, check your point balance and more with the
reward center. Log in to online banking (first-time users will need to create
a user ID and password). Once you log in to your UMB online banking
dashboard, you can access your credit card rewards with the below steps:
Click your credit card account tile
Near the top of the credit card account page, you’ll see two tabs.
Select the Details tab.

Cash back is automatically redeemed as an account credit each quarter with a minimum redemption amount of $50 Learn more  FAQs  Questions about Credit Cards? UMB has answers.  How many credit cards should I have? A credit card can be a helpful tool in your personal financial toolkit. Opening at least one card and paying it on time helps build your credit history and boost your credit score But how many credit cards should you have? There’s not one right answer for everyone It depends on a few things, including your financial situation, financial goals and spending habits Know your spending habits If you have stable income and can easily pay a monthly card balance, having a few credit cards may be smart. You could use certain cards for daily purchases, like gas or groceries, to help you budget and potentially save money Many credit cards offer incentives for rewards, travel or cash back. Loyalty-program credit cards from retail stores often offer points toward purchases or extra discounts If you’re starting out in college or career, opening just one credit card might be a good option. You can use it to pay bills from a single source, making it easier to track payments. In the meantime, you’d accumulate a solid credit history by paying the card on time and keeping it open Either way, know your financial situation and do your research to find your best credit card options. UMB offers a few credit cards to fit your lifestyle Make your credit card work for you A credit card can help build credit history, boost credit score and offer some perks when used responsibly. UMB encourages our customers to make informed financial decisions. Check out this article for more tips on using your credit cards How do credit cards work Knowing how your credit card works can help you get the most benefits from using a credit card. Here’s a quick look at how credit cards work: A credit card isn’t a debit card A debit card is connected to your personal checking account. Each time you use a debit card to make a purchase or pay a bill, there’s a simultaneous electronic withdrawal from your checking account Using a credit card is like taking out a short-term loan. A credit card company approves you to borrow a certain amount of money, and you’ll have to pay it back Know your credit limit A credit limit is the total amount of money you can borrow on your credit card. Your available credit is reduced every time you make a charge. If your credit limit is $1,000 and you make a purchase for $200, your remaining available credit is $800 Grace periods and interest fees The credit card grace period is the time between when you make a charge and when the bill is due. Pay your credit card in full by the due date each statement period, and your account won’t accrue interest If you pay anything less than the full monthly balance, your account is charged interest Interest is based on your credit card’s APR, or annual percentage rate Understand your credit card bill Your monthly credit card bill shows the New Balance and the Minimum Payment Due The Minimum Payment Due is the least amount you can pay by the due date to avoid a late fee. But if you only pay the minimum, your account will accrue interest because you’re paying less than the full amount you owe Maintain healthy credit Credit cards can help you build a strong credit history. But carrying too much debt, making late payments or missing payments can severely hurt your credit.  What is an APR on a credit card? An APR on a credit card stands for “annual percentage rate.” In simplest terms, an APR is used to calculate the interest you’re charged when you carry a balance on a credit card If you pay less than the total monthly balance, a credit card company will charge you interest on your revolving balance and on future advances until the balance is paid in full. If you always pay your total monthly balance, you’re not charged interest Credit cards come with varying APRs. Your credit history and perceived credit risk can affect the APR on your credit card. Typically, the higher (or better) your credit score, the lower your APR For an in-depth look at credit cards and more, check out UMB’s free online personal finance courses How do I apply for a credit card? You can apply for a credit card a few ways: a direct-mail application, online at credit card company website or at a bank branch. Retail stores often allow you to apply for a credit card in-store with customer service UMB offers several options to help you find the right credit card for you. You can apply for a credit card online today What you need for a credit card application All credit card applications require personal information, like your name, address, Social Security number, income and monthly housing payment. A credit card company uses this to research your credit history to determine eligibility and if you’re approved, to determine your credit limit Credit history and several other factors are considered before your application is approved. Before you even apply, consider these questions first: How do credit cards work?  What is the best credit card for me? How many credit cards should I have?  How can I get a credit card with no credit? It might seem frustrating: To get a credit card, you often need to have credit history. But you can’t build credit history if you’ve never had credit (like a credit card or loan) In this case, a secured credit card may be a good option to help you begin to build or restore your credit score. A secured credit card is “secured” by a cash deposit. Your line of credit, or credit limit, is equal to the amount of that deposit •  •  •  Apply for a UMB secured credit card You can use a secured credit card for everyday items or unexpected expenses. And by making responsible monthly payments, you’ll be on track towards building your credit history. To apply or learn more about UMB’s secured credit card option, schedule an appointment with a personal banker at a UMB branch What is the best credit card for me? Credit card companies offer a wide range of options, interest rates and rewards. Focus your search for the best credit card for you with these questions: What’s my credit history and credit score? It's important to check your credit history and credit score on a regular basis. Lenders use this score to evaluate your creditworthiness. Each of the nationwide credit bureaus offer free access to your credit report at  annualcreditreport.com .   Credit card companies offer a credit limit and annual percentage rate (APR) based on your previous credit usage and their assessment of your ability to repay the debt you might incur on that credit limit.   To get an idea of what limit and rates to expect before you apply for a credit card, know your credit score How will I use a credit card? Do you want to build or repair your credit? Earn cash back or points for redemption options? Knowing how you want to use your credit card will help make finding the right one easier Am I willing to pay an annual fee? Usually, credit cards that offer the highest perks also charge an annual fee If you think the fee is worth it because the card matches your financial goals, then it might be a good idea. There are also many credit cards with little or no annual fees. UMB offers a few different Visa credit cards to fit your lifestyle How do I redeem my UMB credit card rewards? Browse your UMB rewards, check your point balance and more with the reward center. Log in to online banking (first-time users will need to create a user ID and password).
